51-percent-attack.definition: Når en miner eller en gruppe af minere kontrollerer mere end 50 % af netværkets mining-hashrate eller computerkraft.

absolute-advantage.definition: An economics concept in which one party has a direct advantage in efficiency in producing/providing a specific good or service over another party.

active-management.definition: An investing strategy employed by fund managers aiming to outperform an index or market in order to generate profits.

actively-validated-services-avs.definition: Aktivt validerede tjenester (AVS) overvåger og validerer kontinuerligt for forbedret sikkerhed, ydeevne og overholdelse i blockchain og kryptovalutaer.

ad-hoc.definition: The phrase 'ad hoc' is a phrase of Latin origin that is used in modern English to mean 'for this purpose' or 'specifically for this.'

address.definition: String of text that designates the location of a particular wallet on the blockchain. Often a hashed version of a public key.

airdrop.definition: Distribution of digital assets to the public, by virtue of holding a certain token or by virtue of being an active wallet address.

algorithm.definition: En sekvens af entydige instruktioner, der bruges til at løse et problem.

all-or-none-order.definition: An AON order, once placed, must either be filled in its entirety or not at all. This prevents any partial filling of orders.

all-time-high.definition: The highest price of a cryptocurrency in a quote​ currency, such as a dollar, BTC, ETH, or BNB

allocation.definition: Percentage distribution of tokens. For example a project may allocate 40% of tokens to their team.

alpha.definition: The first look at a product released by a team, consisting of the very first version of a primitive, basic software or product.

altcoin.definition: A cryptocurrency that is alternative to Bitcoin. Altcoin is used to describe cryptocurrencies that are not Bitcoin.

angel-investor.definition: Wealthy investors that seek out opportunities to provide funding for entrepreneurs or start-up companies.

anti-money-laundering.definition: Juridiske og lovgivningsmæssige procedurer for at minimere og bremse strømmen af midler genereret fra ulovlige eller tvivlsomme aktiviteter.

application-programming-interface.definition: Collection of functions and procedures that allow users to interact with the data of an application.

application-specific-integrated-circuit.definition: An Integrated Circuit customized for maximum performance in a particular use.

arbitrage.definition: Køb og salg af aktiver over forskellige markeder for at drage fordel af forskellige priser på det samme aktiv.

arc-20.definition: Lær om Atomicals ARC-20-tokens, som er en tokenstandard for fungible tokens på bitcoin-blockchainen. Udforsk, hvordan de fungerer, og deres potentielle use cases.

artificial-intelligence-ai.definition: Udforsk den transformerende kraft i kunstig intelligens (AI) på tværs af sundhedspleje, erhvervsliv, uddannelse, finans, sikkerhed, produktion og transport.

asic-resistant.definition: The property of a cryptocurrency that is “immune” to ASIC mining. Allowing the mining to become more decentralized.

asking-price.definition: The lowest price a seller would be willing to accept when placing their sell order while trading an asset on an exchange.

asset-management.definition: A system or method that helps individuals or companies manage assets. Either on behalf of their clients or their own.

assets-under-management-aum.definition: AUM (aktiver under forvaltning) er markedsværdien af finansielle aktiver, der forvaltes af en entitet på vegne af kunder, med angivelse af indflydelse og operationel skala.

asynchronous.definition: Events in electronic systems that do not happen at the same time or speed, or happen independent of the main program flow.

atomic-swap.definition: A technique of peer-to-peer cryptocurrency trading based on smart contract technology that removes the need for intermediaries.

attack-surface.definition: Points in a software environment where an attacker can attempt to enter or extract data from the system.

auction.definition: A live event where assets or services are negotiated through a bidding process, which is often led by an auctioneer.

automated-market-maker-amm.definition: Automatiserede Market Makers (AMM'er) er et undersæt af DEX-protokoller (Decentraliseret Exchange). De giver brugerne mulighed for at handle med digitale aktiver uden behov for en mellemmand.

b-tokens.definition: B-Tokens er navnet på en række indpakkede tokens med fuld sikkerhedsstillelse, der er præget af Binance.

bags.definition: The portfolio of coins and tokens one is holding. Often related to a poorly performing bag of assets that investors insist to hold.

beacon-chain.definition: Beacon Chain er Ethereums Proof of Stake-layer (PoS), hvor der opnås konsensus.

bear-market.definition: A negative trend in prices of a market. It is widely used not only in the cryptocurrency space but also in the traditional markets

benchmark.definition: A measurement standard which can be used to gauge the performance of a particular asset or investment portfolio

bep-1155.definition: BEP-1155-tokenstandarden gør det muligt at kombinere fungible og non-fungible tokens (NFT) i en enkelt smart contract i BNB Chain.

bep-20.definition: BEP-20 er en tokenstandard på BNB Smart Chain, der udvider ERC-20 – den mest almindelige Ethereum-tokenstandard.

bep-721.definition: BEP-721 er en BNB Smart Chain-tokenstandard (BSC), der gør det muligt at skabe non-fungible tokens (NFT'er).

bep-95.definition: BEP-95 er et Binance Evolution-forslag, der introducerer en brændingsmekanisme i realtid til BNB Smart Chain. Det gør BNB tokenomics mere dynamisk og decentraliseret.

beta-coefficient.definition: A tool used to measure the volatility of an asset in comparison to the volatility of a specific portfolio or market index.

beta-release.definition: An early version of a program for users to test and for a team to get feedback. This stage comes after the Alpha stage.

bid-price.definition: In the context of financial markets, it is the value buyers offer for an asset, such as a commodity, security, or cryptocurrency.

bid-ask-spread.definition: The difference in price between the lowest asking price and highest bid price on the order book for an asset.

binance-ecosystem-fund.definition: An initiative by Binance to collaborate with partners who care about the blockchain/cryptocurrency ecosystem.

binancian.definition: En "binancian" er et udtryk, der henviser til personer, som er aktivt involveret i eller bidrager til kryptovalutabørsen Binance.

bitcoin.definition: A cryptocurrency created by the pseudonymous developer(s) Satoshi Nakamoto, initially described as a 'Peer-to-Peer e-cash'.

bitcoin-core.definition: Leading implementation of the software that enables users to interact with the Bitcoin network. Initially released by Satoshi.

bitcoin-dominance.definition: The ratio of Bitcoin's market capitalization versus the sum of the market capitalizations of all cryptocurrencies.

bitcoin-maximalists.definition: Bitcoin-maksimalister er enkeltpersoner, der mener, at bitcoin er den eneste værdifulde kryptovaluta og fremtiden for global økonomi.

bitcoin-pizza.definition: The first known transaction where Bitcoin was exchanged for a physical good. Laszlo Hanyecz paid 10,000 BTC for two pizzas.

black-swan-event.definition: An event that is often entirely unexpected and deviates from the expected result causing widespread ramifications.

block.definition: A computer file that stores transaction data. These can then be arranged in a linear sequence, which will form a blockchain.

block-explorer.definition: Online Blockchain webpage which allows users to browse information about blocks, transactions, balances and more.

block-header.definition: A section in a block containing metadata and a summary of the block's transactions. This is the information hashed when mining.

block-height.definition: The number of blocks in the chain between itself and the first block on that blockchain (genesis block or block 0).

block-reward.definition: Summen af coins, der tildeles af blockchain-protokollen til kryptovalutaminere for hver minet og valideret blok, der er blevet godkendt.

blockchain.definition: En decentraliseret, digitaliseret ledger, der registrerer transaktionsoplysninger om en kryptovaluta i kronologisk rækkefølge.

binance-blockchain-charity-foundation.definition: The world's first decentralized charity platform to advocate the concept of 'blockchain for social good'.

bloom-filter.definition: A data structure which is able to be used to inform the user whether a particular item is part of a set of items

blue-chip-token.definition: Blue-chip-kryptovalutaer er coins, der har klaret tidens test. Disse aktiver er etablerede og har en pålidelig værdi.

bnb.definition: Lanceret efter et indledende coin-udbud, der sluttede den 3. juli 2017. Bruges til at modtage rabatter på børshandelsgebyrer med mere.

bnsol.definition: BNSOL er et omsætteligt token, der repræsenterer din stakede SOL på Binance. Det er et likvidt staking-token, der tilbyder likviditet og kapitaleffektivitet.

bollinger-bands.definition: A technical analysis indicator that measures market volatility. It's made of two sidelong bands and a simple moving average.

bond.definition: Obligationer er en type fastforrentet investering, der repræsenterer et lån fra en investor til en låntager, typisk en virksomhed eller regering.

bounty.definition: A reward posted by a group or individual to incentivize certain work, behavior (such as referrals), or development.

brc-20-tokens.definition: BRC-20 er en eksperimentel tokenstandard, der gør det muligt at præge og overføre fungible tokens via ordinaler-protokollen på bitcoin-blockchainen.

break-even-point.definition: The point where the total costs of an operation is equivalent to its current value or revenue.

breakeven-multiple.definition: The multiple of the current price by which an asset needs to appreciate in order to reach its previous all-time high.

breakout.definition: When the price of an asset moves outside of a defined range or pattern, typically by breaking out of a support or resistance area.

bscscan.definition: BscScan er en blockchain-udforsker til BNB Smart Chain-brugere (BSC). Den blev udviklet af det samme team bag den populære Ethereum-blockchain-udforsker, Etherscan.

btc-wallet-address.definition: En BTC-wallet-adresse er en unik række af bogstaver og tal, der bruges til at sende og modtage bitcoin-transaktioner.

buidl.definition: Originally derived from HODL, a term referring to keeping your heads down and focusing on building your product.

bull-market.definition: A positive trend in prices of a market. It is widely used not only in the cryptocurrency space but also in the traditional markets

burner-wallet.definition: Udforsk brænder-wallets, som er midlertidige kryptovaluta-wallets, som brugerne kan bruge til at interagere sikkert med potentielt farlige blockchain-applikationer.

buy-wall.definition: A single huge buy order or the composition of multiple large buy orders at the same price in the order book of a particular market.

candidate-block.definition: En midlertidig blok skabt af en mining-node (miner), der skal føjes til blockchainen for at modtage block-belønningerne.

candlestick.definition: A graph representation of price action that displays the open, close, high, and low points within a certain period.

capitulation.definition: A period of strong selling activity, where investors give up their positions and sell their holdings as quickly as possible.

censorship-resistance.definition: The property of a cryptocurrency network that prevents any entity from altering transactions on it.

central-bank.definition: A financial institution that acts as a monetary authority and manages a states currency, interest rates, and money supply.

central-bank-digital-currency-cbdc.definition: Digital centralbankvaluta (CBDC) er et officielt sanktioneret digitalt betalingsmiddel, der er udstedt af en statslig centralbank. CBDC'er kan være enten engros eller detail.

central-processing-unit.definition: The part of a computer responsible for interpreting instructions of computer programs and executing operations.

centralized.definition: When the planning and decision-making mechanisms are concentrated in a particular point within a system.

centralized-exchange.definition: Forstå verdenen af centraliserede børser, traditionelle kryptomarkeder, der er kendt for høj likviditet, avancerede handelsværktøjer og risikoovervejelser.

chatgpt.definition: ChatGPT er en sprogbehandlingsmodel udviklet af OpenAI. Den repræsenterer et betydeligt fremskridt inden for naturlig sprogbehandling (NLP)

cipher.definition: A method for encrypting and decrypting messages. Ciphers can be divided into symmetric or asymmetric, according to their key model.

circulating-supply.definition: The best approximate number of cryptocurrency coins or tokens that are publicly available and circulating in the market.

cloud.definition: In computer science, a shared pool of resources, which are made available to multiple users through the Internet.

coin.definition: A cryptocurrency or digital cash that is independent of any other platform, which is used as exchange of value.

cold-storage.definition: Opdag det grundlæggende ved cold storage: Find ud af, hvad det er, og hvordan det beskytter dine kryptovalutabeholdninger.

collateral.definition: Pledging something of value against a loan to guarantee that the person taking the loan will complete repayment.

colocation.definition: A dedicated space in a data center belonging to stock exchanges which is shared with other entities such as high-frequency traders.

commodity-futures-trading-commission.definition: US-based agency responsible for regulating derivatives, including options, swaps, and futures.

compound-interest.definition: Med renters rente menes de renter, der akkumuleres på hovedstolen ud over renterne fra tidligere perioder.

confirmation-time.definition: Det interval, der er nødvendigt for, at en blockchain-transaktion kan godkendes og føjes til ledgeren.

confluence.definition: When multiple investment methods, technical indicators, or trading signals are combined to form a more reliable strategy.

consensus-algorithm.definition: Konsensusalgoritmer er mekanismer, der hjælper forskellige computere i et blockchain-netværk med at blive enige om, hvad der er sandt, selvom nogle af dem ikke spiller fair.

consumer-price-index-(cpi).definition: A Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a measure used to track the effects of inflation over a period of time.

contango-and-backwardation.definition: Contango og backwardation bruges til at beskrive forholdet mellem futuresprisen på en råvare og dens forventede fremtidige spotpris. De er nyttige mål for handel og afdækning.

copy-trading.definition: Opdag fordelene ved kryptokopihandel. Lær mere om, hvordan du kopierer handler, administrerer risiko, spreder investeringer og fremmer fælles læring med Binance Academy.

counterparty-risk.definition: Modpartsrisiko er risikoen for, at den ene part i en finansiel transaktion misligholder eller undlader at opfylde sine kontraktlige forpligtelser, hvilket medfører økonomiske tab for den anden part.

credentials.definition: Personal information. Examples include username, password, email address, qualifications and many more.

cross-chain-bridges.definition: Blockchain-broer forbinder forskellige blockchain-netværk, muliggør bevægelse af digitale aktiver på tværs af netværk og letter interoperabilitet i kryptorummet.

crypto-etfs.definition: Krypto-ETF'er giver investorer mulighed for at eksponere sig mod kursbevægelser i kryptovalutaer uden at eje eller forvalte dem direkte.

crypto-fear-and-greed-index.definition: Crypto Fear and Greed-indekset er et værktøj, der bruger flere indikatorer til at måle den samlede stemning på kryptovalutamarkedet i scoreintervallet 0-100.

crypto-protocol.definition: En kryptoprotokol er et sæt regler og procedurer, der styrer adfærd i et decentraliseret netværk.

crypto-winter.definition: Udtrykket kryptovinter henviser til en længere periode med faldende eller stagnerende priser og negativ stemning på kryptovalutamarkedet.

cryptocurrency.definition: En digital valuta, der er sikret med kryptografi til at fungere som et vekselmedium inden for et peer-to-peer (P2P) økonomisk system.

cryptography.definition: Den videnskabelige brug af matematiske teorier og beregninger til at kryptere og dekryptere information.

custody.definition: Henviser til opbevaring af aktiver på vegne af en kunde. Kan også henvise til ejerskabet af ens midler eller aktiver.

daemon.definition: A process operating in the background waiting for a specific event or condition in order to be activated.

danksharding.definition: Danksharding introducerer en ny tilgang til sharding og spiller en afgørende rolle i optimeringen af datastyring og transaktionsbehandling på Ethereum-netværket.

dead-cat-bounce.definition: A brief recovery in the price of a declining asset that is shortly followed by a continuation of the downtrend.

death-cross.definition: Udforsk dødskrydset og dets rolle i forudsigelse af markedsnedgang. Lær, hvordan det fungerer, og hvilke indikatorer det kan bruges med til bedre markedssignaler.

decentralized-application.definition: DApps er applikationer, der kører på et P2P-netværk af computere i stedet for en central database. Brugere kan frit oprette forbindelse til DApps ved hjælp af krypto-wallets.

decentralized-autonomous-cooperative.definition: An organization that is controlled by shareholders rather than a central authority.

decentralized-autonomous-organization.definition: Definition: Et system af hårdt kodede regler, der definerer, hvilke handlinger en decentraliseret organisation vil udføre.

decentralized-exchange.definition: An exchange which does not require users to deposit funds to start trading and does not hold the funds for the user.

decentralized-indexes.definition: Et decentraliseret indeks er en type investeringsinstrument, der sporer præstationerne for flere kryptovalutaer eller digitale aktiver, der handles på decentraliserede børser.

decryption.definition: The act of reverting an encryption process so that unreadable data (ciphertext) can be converted into readable data (plaintext).

deep-web.definition: The part of the web that is somehow hidden, i.e., not indexed by Google and other traditional web sarch engines.

delisting.definition: The removal of an asset from an exchange either as a request from the project team or as a decision made by the exchange.

depeg.definition: Lær om årsager, konsekvenser og forebyggende foranstaltninger for at undgå en depeg og sikre stablecoins pålidelighed og tilliden hertil på kryptovalutamarkedet.

depression.definition: Forstå økonomisk depression: Udforsk dens årsager, konsekvenser, og hvordan den kan påvirke kryptovalutamarkederne i tider med finansiel ustabilitet.

design-flaw-attack.definition: Smart contract, decentralized market, or other software created with intentional flaws to trick users interacting with them

diamond-hands.definition: Diamanthænder henviser til at beholde et finansielt aktiv og ikke sælge det, uanset dets volatilitet.

difficulty.definition: In cryptocurrency, difficulty indicates the difficulty required to mine a block. Learn more at Binance Academy.

difficulty-bomb.definition: The term 'difficulty bomb' denotes the increase in mining difficulty in Ethereum, as part of its migration to Proof of Stake.

digital-signature.definition: Et kryptografisk værktøj til at verificere ægtheden og integriteten af digitale data, der sikrer sikkerheden i datakommunikation og transaktioner med kryptovaluta.

direct-market-access-dma.definition: Direkte markedsadgang giver investorer mulighed for at placere handler direkte på børser og omgå mæglere for hurtigere udførelse, mere kontrol og lavere gebyrer.

divergence.definition: When the market price of an asset and a technical indicator (e.g. RSI, Volume, MACD) are heading in opposite directions.

diversification.definition: The allocation of funds across different types of assets and jurisdictions in order to reduce the overall risks.

do-your-own-research.definition: et værdifuldt råd. Det er altid klogt at undersøge en coin selv i stedet for at følge, hvad andre siger.

dollar-cost-averaging.definition: Investing fixed dollar amounts over regular periods of time regardless of the price of the asset.

dot-plot.definition: Opdag effekten af punktdiagrammer til visualisering af data. Lær om Cleveland og Wilkinson-punktdiagrammer, og Feds punktdiagram for renter.

double-spending.definition: When a given amount of coins are spent more than once. Usually as a result of a race attack or a 51% attack.

eclipse-attack.definition: When peers on the network are malicious and monopolize the network in order to prevent specific nodes from communicating.

efficient-market-hypothesis-emh.definition: An economic theory stating financial markets reflect all available information on the price of assets at any time.

eigenlayer.definition: Opdag EigenLayer: en protokol, der introducerede Ethereums genstakingsfællesskab for decentraliseret tillid, og som tilbyder sikkerhed, innovation og fleksibilitet.

eip.definition: EIP stands for Ethereum Improvement Proposal. It’s a way for the Ethereum community to suggest upgrades or new ideas for the blockchain.

eip-3074.definition: Lær, hvordan EIP-3074 kan transformere Ethereum med forbedret transaktionssikkerhed og fleksibilitet. Hold dig opdateret om dens integration i Ethereum Pectra-opgraderingen.

eip-4844.definition: EIP-4844, også kendt som proto-danksharding, er en foreslået opgradering, der fokuserer på at reducere Ethereums gebyrer og øge transaktionshastigheden.

eip-7251.definition: EIP-7251 aims to improve Ethereum’s scalability and efficiency by reducing the number of active validators while maintaining decentralization.

eip-7702.definition: Opdag, hvordan EIP-7702-forslaget kan forbedre Ethereum ved at føje smart contract-funktioner til eksternt ejede konti (EOA'er).

elasticity.definition: Forstå elasticitet – målet for, hvordan en variabel reagerer på ændringer i en anden variabel. Lær, hvordan elasticitet bruges i handel og til hverdag.

encryption.definition: Conversion of information or data into a secure code in order to prevent unauthorised access to the information or data.

endogenous-variable.definition: Udforsk endogene variabler, som er variabler, der afspejler den interne dynamik i en økonomisk model. Lær nogle eksempler på endogene variabler i krypto.

erc-1155.definition: Oplev alsidigheden ved ERC-1155-tokens. Ideelle til spil, som digitale samleobjekter og til effektiv håndtering af flere token-typer.

erc-20.definition: A technical standard used to issue and implement tokens on the Ethereum blockchain proposed in November 2015 by Fabian Vogelsteller.

erc-404.definition: ERC-404 er en tokenstandard, der blander fungibilitet og non-fungibilitet. Lær om dens unikke egenskaber, semi-fungible natur, prægnings- og brændemekanisme og meget mere.

erc-721.definition: An Ethereum based non-fungible token. This means that each token is unique and as a result, not interchangeable.

etf.definition: Lær, hvad ETF'er er, og udforsk deres rolle på kryptovalutamarkedet: fordele, konsekvenser og udfordringer for investorer og det finansielle økosystem.

ethereum-classic.definition: Ethereum Classic (ETC) opstod fra den berygtede Ethereum-hard fork (blockchain), der skete som et resultat af DAO-hacket (decentraliseret autonom organisation) i 2016. I modsætning til ETH bruger ETC stadig Proof-of-Work.

ethereum-foundation.definition: Udforsk Ethereum Foundations rolle i blockchain-udviklingen. Fra forskning til fællesskabsstøtte – opdag, hvordan den former fremtiden for decentraliseret teknologi.

ethereum-virtual-machine-evm.definition: Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) er en Turing-komplet programmerbar maskine, som udfører smart contracts, som typisk er kodet i Solidity.

exchange.definition: A marketplace for cryptocurrencies where users can buy and sell coins.

exogenous-variable.definition: Udforsk eksogene variabler, som er variabler, der hjælper med at forklare de eksterne påvirkninger, der kan påvirke økonomiske modeller. Lær om eksogene variabler i krypto.

exponential-moving-average-ema.definition: Eksponentielle glidende gennemsnit er kortlægningsværktøjer, der giver mere vægt til de seneste prisdata, hvilket giver et mere responsivt billede af markedstendensen.

externally-owned-account-eoa.definition: Lær om eksternt ejede konti (EOA'er) på Ethereum, hvordan de fungerer, deres rolle i transaktioner og vigtigheden af at beskytte din private key.

fakeout.definition: A situation where a trader enters a position betting on a price movement that quickly reverses or ultimately doesn’t happen.

falling-knife.definition: Refers to the action of purchasing an asset while it is rapidly declining in price under the expectation that it will bounce.

fan-tokens.definition: Fan tokens are digital assets that are created by sports teams, clubs or brands to increase fan engagement and create new revenue streams.

fear-of-missing-out.definition: The feeling of fear and anxiety that you might be missing out on a potentially profitable opportunity.

fear-uncertainty-and-doubt.definition: A marketing strategy used to spread fear and insecurity among customers, traders, or investors.

fiat.definition: Money that a government has declared to be legal tender.

fibonacci-retracement.definition: Fibonacci Retracement is a popular technical analysis (TA) tool used by traders to identify potential support and resistance levels in financial markets.

fill-or-kill-order.definition: A buy or sell order which must be executed immediately in its entirety or else it will be cancelled.

finality.definition: The assurance or guarantee that completed (cryptocurrency) transactions cannot be altered, reversed or canceled.

first-mover-advantage.definition: A competitive advantage of the first project to bring a service or product into a new and unexplored market or industry.

fiscal-policy.definition: Beskriver, hvordan myndighederne justerer skattesatserne i et land og påvirker, hvordan offentlige midler skal opkræves og anvendes.

flappening.definition: The name to describe the moment when Litecoin (LTC) surpassed Bitcoin Cash (BCH) in terms of market capitalization

flashbots.definition: Udforsk Flashbots, en forsknings- og udviklingsorganisation med fokus på at forfine MEV-relaterede blockchain-løsninger på Ethereum.

flippening.definition: The name to describe the moment when/if Ethereum (ETH) surpasses Bitcoin (BTC) in terms of market capitalization

flow-variable.definition: Udforsk flowvariabler, som er målinger, der afspejler mængden af noget over en bestemt periode. Få mere at vide om, hvad flowvariabler er, og nogle eksempler.

forced-liquidation.definition: When a trader's leveraged position is forcibly closed as a result of it not fulfilling the necessary margin requirements.

forex-fx.definition: Forex stands for Foreign Exchange Markets. It's a global market for the trading of fiat currencies.

fork.definition: En fork er en divergens i blockchain-netværket ved at skabe en opdeling i blockchains transaktionshistorik. Der findes to typer forks – soft og hard.

formal-verification.definition: Using mathematically rigorous proofs to ensure certain properties of cryptographic algorithms and blockchain mechanisms

fraud-proof.definition: Et bevis for svig er et kryptografisk bevis, som en verifikator indsender for at anfægte en transaktions gyldighed. De bruges i vid udstrækning til blockchain-skalerbarhed.

fren.definition: "Fren" er et online slangudtryk, der bruges til at tiltale nogen på en venlig måde. Det blev udviklet i digitale fællesskaber og bruges i vid udstrækning i kryptofællesskabet.

full-node.definition: Computer that fully implements the entirety of rules of an underlying blockchain network and validates transactions on a blockchain.

fully-diluted-valuation-fdv.definition: Fully Diluted Valuation (FDV) is a metric that tells us what a crypto project’s market value could be if all its tokens were available for trading now.

fundamental-analysis.definition: Evaluering af et aktiv baseret på dets underliggende egenskaber og træk som et forsøg på at nå frem til en iboende værdi.

funding-fees.definition: Finansieringsgebyrer er betalinger foretaget mellem handlende, der har lange (købe) eller korte (sælge) positioner på evige futuresmarkeder.

fungibility.definition: The property of an asset whose individual units are indistinguishable from each other in terms of value and functionality.

futures-contract.definition: A legal agreement made between a buyer and a seller to trade an asset at a predefined price and date in the future.

gamefi.definition: GameFi er en del af DeFi, der fusionerer blockchain-teknologi og gaming og tilbyder play-to-earn-incitamenter gennem NFT'er og kryptovalutaer.

gas.definition: Den prismekanisme, der anvendes på Ethereum-blockchainen til at beregne omkostningerne ved smart contracts-operationer og transaktionsgebyrer.

gas-limit.definition: Maximum price a cryptocurrency user is willing to pay as a fee when sending a transaction, or performing a smart contract function.

gdp-deflator.definition: Udforsk BNP-deflatoren, som er et økonomisk værktøj, der måler inflationen i varer og tjenester, der produceres i et land. Lær om dens use cases inden for krypto.

general-public-license.definition: License allowing users to copy and modify software, but requires the works to be distributed under the same license.

genesis-block.definition: The first ever block recorded on its respective blockchain network, also referred to as Block 0 or Block 1.

github.definition: A site/system/folder/repository where a team can share, collaborate, and save their open source or proprietary code.

gm-good-morning.definition: GM står for "Good Morning", og brugen af det i kryptofællesskabet afspejler rummets inkluderende og samarbejdende natur.

golden-cross.definition: A bullish chart pattern where a shorter-term moving average crosses above a longer-term moving average.

golden-ratio.definition: Lås op for hemmelighederne bag det gyldne snit i handel! Opdag, hvordan Fibonacci retracement-niveauer stemmer overens med dette matematiske vidunder og påvirker markedsanalyser.

goldilocks.definition: Udforsk virkningen af Guldlok-princippet i økonomien, dets konsekvenser for kryptovalutamarkeder, og hvordan det påvirker investorernes stemning.

gossip-protocol.definition: A particular method of asynchronous peer-to-peer communication between computer nodes of a distributed system.

gross-domestic-product-gdp.definition: Lær, hvad bruttonationalproduktet (BNP) er, hvordan det beregnes, dets indvirkning på finans- og kryptovalutamarkederne, og hvorfor det er vigtigt i vores økonomi.

gwei.definition: En lille værdibetegnelse af ether. Det bruges i vid udstrækning som et mål for gaspriser. 1.000.000.000 wei = 1 Giga wei (gwei)

hackathon.definition: A blockchain hackathon is a competition where participants build sample applications atop a blockchain ecosystem.

hacker.definition: An individual that has an advanced understanding of computer systems and networks, including programmers and cybersecurity experts.

haha-money-printer-go-brrrrr.definition: Haha Money Printer Go Brrrrr is meme created in response to the Federal Reserve's 2020 plan to print money.

halving.definition: Halvering er en proces, der reducerer block-belønningen for en PoW-krypto såsom bitcoin (BTCI) til det halve. Den næste halvering af bitcoin forventes omkring 2024.

hard-cap.definition: The maximum amount of funds a project intends to raise during their Initial Coin Offering (ICO) or alternative fundraising event.

hard-landing.definition: I økonomiske termer refererer en hård landing til en situation, hvor en økonomi hurtigt overgår fra vækst til langsom vækst eller recession.

hash.definition: The output produced by a hash function after a piece of data is mapped. May also be referred to as hash value, hash code, or digest.

hash-rate.definition: The speed at which a computer or mining hardware is able to calculate new hashes. Usually measured in hashes per second.

hashed-timelock-contract.definition: Refers to a special feature that is used to create smart contracts that are able to modify payment channels.

herd-instinct.definition: Flokinstinkt beskriver et fænomen, hvor handlende har tendens til at gentage mængdens handlinger, ofte uden at gøre deres egen research.

high-frequency-trading-hft.definition: A type of algorithmic trading that involves the execution of a large number of orders in fractions of a second.

hodl.definition: A typo of 'Hold' originating from bitcointalk that has also been retrofitted to be an acronym for Hold on for Dear Life.

honeypot.definition: A mechanism used in computer security used to detect or counteract unauthorized access of information systems.

iceberg-order.definition: Conditional order to buy or sell a large amount of assets in smaller quantities to conceal the total order quantity.

immutability.definition: The inability to change or be changed. One of the core features behind Bitcoin and blockchain technology.

index.definition: A financial instrument used to track the price value of a given asset or basket of assets

index-funds.definition: Lær om indeksfonde, hvordan de fungerer, deres potentielle fordele og ulemper og deres potentielle indvirkning på blockchain- og kryptovalutamarkeder.

initial-coin-offering.definition: A fundraising method in which new projects will sell their cryptocurrency to investors.

initial-dex-offering-ido.definition: Et indledende DEX-udbud (Initial DEX Offering, IDO) er en type blockchain-fundraisingmetode. Det er et offentligt tokensalg, der udføres direkte på en decentraliseret exchange (DEX).

initial-exchange-offering.definition: The fundraising will be conducted on a well-known exchange’s fundraising platform, such as Binance Launchpad

initial-public-offering.definition: Refers to the moment a private company starts offering its shares to the public for the first time.

inscription.definition: Et stykke data, såsom tekst, billeder eller kode, der føjes til Bitcoins mindste enheder, satoshier, og lagres på blockchainen.

integrated-circuit.definition: A small chip, typically made of silicon, that holds a set of electronic parts such as transistors, resistors or capacitors.

interest-rates.definition: Renter kan enten henvise til omkostningerne ved at låne penge eller afkastet på en investering, normalt udtrykt som en procentdel af det primære beløb.

interoperability.definition: A concept of allowing blockchains to be compatible with each other and build upon each other's features and use-cases.

interplanetary-file-system-ipfs.definition: An open-source project building a protocol for distributed content storage and access.

iou.definition: Et akronym, der står for "I owe you" (Jeg skylder dig) og henviser til et uformelt dokument, der anerkender en gæld, som en part skylder en anden.

isolated-margin.definition: The margin balance allocated to a position. Traders can manage risk by restricting the amount allocated to each position.

issuance.definition: Generation of a new cryptocurrency which occurs in a variety of different ways, depending on parameters specified by the creators.

keccak.definition: En alsidig kryptografisk funktion, som er udviklet af Guido Bertoni, Joan Daemen, Michaël Peeters og Gilles Van Assche.

know-your-customer.definition: En standardprocedure i finansbranchen, som gør det muligt for virksomheder at identificere deres kunder og overholde KYC-lovgivningen for bekæmpelse af hvidvask af penge.

laspeyres-index.definition: Udforsk Laspeyres-indekset, som er et værktøj til måling af prisændringer over tid. Forstå dets brug på traditionelle markeder og anvendelsesmuligheder i kryptovalutaer.

latency.definition: The time between submitting a transaction to a network and the first confirmation of acceptance by the network.

law-of-demand.definition: The law of demand relates to the willingness of consumers to buy a specific amount of goods or services for a particular price.

layer-2.definition: A secondary framework or protocol that is built on top of an existing blockchain system to provide increased scalability.

ledger.definition: A physical book or a digital computer file where monetary and financial transactions are tracked and recorded.

leveraged-tokens.definition: Leveraged tokens are a type of cryptocurrency derivative that allows traders to gain leveraged exposure to a particular cryptocurrency without having to manage the margin requirements.

library.definition: A collection of stable resources, which may include executable files, documentation, message templates, and written code.

lightning-network.definition: A second layer operating on top of a blockchain, enabling increased transaction speed among participating nodes.

limit-order.definition: Lær om limitordrer i handel, og hvordan de kan hjælpe dig med at kontrollere transaktionspriser, undgå slippage og navigere effektivt på volatile markeder.

linux.definition: A popular open-source operating system, created in 1991 by Linus Torvalds. It is used in a wide range of devices around the world.

liquid-staking.definition: Likvid staking er en populær metode til udbyttefarming, hvor brugerne tokeniserer deres stakede aktiver for at øge likviditeten og fleksibiliteten på DeFi-platforme.

liquid-staking-token-lst.definition: Opdag likvid staking-tokens (LST) i krypto. Få mere at vide om, hvordan du frigør likviditet og fleksibilitet i forbindelse med stakede aktiver. Udforsk WBETH- og DeFi-indtjeningsmuligheder.

liquidity.definition: The ability to sell or buy any given asset without causing significant fluctuations in the market price for that asset.

liquidity-crisis.definition: En likviditetskrise er en økonomisk situation, hvor en person, en organisation eller et marked står over for en mangel på kontanter, hvilket gør det vanskeligt at opfylde umiddelbare økonomiske forpligtelser.

liquidity-provider.definition: Likviditetsudbydere (LP'er) er enheder eller enkeltpersoner, der leverer købs- og salgsordrer til de finansielle markeder for at øge markedslikviditeten og sikre et stabilt og effektivt marked.

liquidity-ratios.definition: Likviditetsnøgletal er en form for finansiel måling, der bruges til at måle en virksomheds evne til at betale kortsigtede forpligtelser.

listing.definition: The addition of an asset to an exchange either as a request from the project team or as a decision made by the exchange.

mainnet.definition: En blockchain-protokol, der er fuldt udviklet og implementeret, hvor transaktioner udsendes, verificeres og registreres.

mainnet-swap.definition: When a coin migrates from a third party platform such as Ethereum or other token to a native on-chain token on their mainnet.

maker.definition: When you place an order and it does not trade immediately, your order stays in the order book for someone else to fill/match with it.

malware.definition: Any software program or code that is created to infiltrate and intentionally cause damage to computer systems and networks.

margin-trading.definition: Trading using borrowed funds  - note: this is a high risk strategy and should only be done by experienced investors.

market-capitalization.definition: Den samlede handelsværdi af en given coin – beregnet som produktet af udbuddet af coinen og den aktuelle pris.

market-momentum.definition: The ability of a certain market to maintain a continuous increase or decrease in price within a particular timeframe.

market-order.definition: Når en taker vælger den bedste tilgængelige budpris eller udbudspris på en kryptovaluta og tager den pris og mængde, der er tilgængelig i ordrebogen.

masternode.definition: Nodes on a network that often require a minimum amount of a given coin staked in order to access staking rewards.

matching-engine.definition: En matchende maskine er et stykke software, der er designet til at behandle handelsordrer, hvilket sikrer, at købere og sælgere betales korrekt på de finansielle markeder.

maximum-supply.definition: Refers to the maximum number of coins or tokens that will be ever created for a given cryptocurrency.

mempool.definition: A node’s mechanism for keeping track of unconfirmed transactions that the node has seen (but have not yet been added to a block).

merged-mining.definition: The act of mining two or more cryptocurrencies at the same time, without sacrificing overall mining performance

merkle-tree.definition: En måde at organisere og strukturere store mængder data på for at gøre det lettere at behandle dem. En hashbaseret datastruktur.

metadata.definition: Data that includes information about other data, such as information about features of a specific transaction.

metaverse.definition: Metaverset er et koncept om et vedvarende, online, virtuelt 3D-miljø, som mange mener vil være et nøgleelement i fremtidens digitale oplevelser.

microtransactions.definition: Udforsk mikrotransaktionernes verden i forbindelse med blockchain, og lær, hvordan Lightning Network fortsætter med at revolutionere bitcoin-betalinger.

mining.definition: Verifikation af transaktioner på et blockchain-netværk, hvor transaktioner tilføjes som poster i blockchain-ledgeren.

mining-farm.definition: A collection of many miners, often in a warehouse or large data center devoted to mining cryptocurrencies

mint.definition: Prægning føjer nye tokens til kryptoøkosystemet, så de kan handles eller bruges inden for netværket. Prægning ligner mining med nogle vigtige forskelle.

monetary-policy.definition: Henviser til de politikker, som myndighederne opretter og vedtager for at kontrollere pengemængden og renten i et land.

money-markets.definition: Pengemarkeder er steder, hvor mennesker og institutioner handler kortfristede finansielle instrumenter som skatkammerbeviser og indskudsbeviser (CD'er). Læs mere på Binance Academy.

monitoring-tag.definition: Et tag, der bruges på Binance-platformen til at klassificere kryptovalutaprojekter, der er relativt mere etablerede sammenlignet med projekter med Seed-tagget.

moon.definition: A colloquial expression used to describe a cryptocurrency or other asset that is experiencing a strong upward market trend.

moving-average-envelopes.definition: Udforsk indhyllingskurver for glidende gennemsnit, TA-værktøjer, der består af to bånd omkring et centralt glidende gennemsnit. Læs mere om, hvordan de fungerer, og hvad de tilbyder.

moving-average-ribbon.definition: Udforsk bånd med glidende gennemsnit – kombinationer af glidende gennemsnit, der bruges til at identificere markedstendenser, markedsmomentum og potentielle markedstilbageførsler.

mt-gox.definition: Oplev storheden og faldet for Mt. Gox Gox, engang den største bitcoinbørs. Lær om dens sammenbrud, sikkerhedsbrud, juridiske eftervirkninger og mere på Binance Academy.

multisignature.definition: Wallet which requires another party to authorize a transaction before it is broadcasted to the network.

nakamoto-consensus.definition: Få mere at vide om Nakamoto-konsensus, en vigtig protokol oprettet af satoshi Nakamoto, der gjorde det muligt at skabe sikre og decentraliserede blockchain-netværk.

net-asset-value-nav.definition: Nettoaktivværdien er værdien af en entitets aktiver minus dens passiver. Den hjælper investorer med at forstå prisen på hver aktie i en investeringsforening eller ETF.

nft-floor-prices.definition: Mindstepriser repræsenterer den laveste værdi, du kan købe et NFT til inden for en samling.

nft-mystery-boxes.definition: Non-fungible token (NFT) mystery boxes are a type of digital collectible that contain a random assortment of NFTs that are unknown the buyer until they open the box.

ngmi.definition: NGMI er et akronym for "Not Gonna Make It", der bruges til at udtrykke en følelse af pessimisme i forhold til at opnå succes eller overvinde en udfordring.

node.definition: A participant on a blockchain network that communicates with other participants to ensure the security and integrity of the system.

non-fungible-token-nft.definition: En type kryptografisk token, der repræsenterer et unikt digitalt eller virkeligt aktiv og ikke kan udskiftes.

nonce.definition: A single-use arbitrary string or number generated for verification purposes to prevent replaying past transactions.

oco-order.definition: An OCO (One Cancels the Other) order allows you to place two orders at the same time. It combines a limit order with a stop-limit order but only one of them can be executed.

off-chain.definition: Opdag, hvordan transaktioner off-chain i krypto forbedrer skalerbarheden og hastigheden. Udforsk deres anvendelse i layer 2-løsninger, der reducerer transaktionsomkostningerne.

offline-signing-orchestrator-oso.definition: Orkestrator til offlinesignering (OSO) er en teknologi, der er udviklet af IBM til at forbedre sikkerheden for kryptoaktiver og digitale aktiver, når de opbevares i cold storage.

offshore-account.definition: An account that is registered in a jurisdiction that is different to the jurisdiction of the holder's citizenship.

on-chain.definition: På kæden (on-chain) henviser til transaktioner og aktiviteter, der registreres direkte på blockchainen, hvilket sikrer datagennemsigtighed, sikkerhed og uforanderlighed.

opbnb.definition: opBNB fungerer som en vigtig layer 2-skaleringsløsning, der på strategisk vis aflaster transaktionsbehandling og ressourceforbrug fra BNB Smart Chain.

open-source-software-oss.definition: Software released under a license that gives anyone the ability and right to use, update, and distribute it freely.

opportunity-cost.definition: Opdag, hvilken rolle mulighedsomkostninger spiller i økonomi og handel, og hvordan det kan hjælpe dig med at træffe bedre beslutninger. Få mere at vide om, hvordan du beregner mulighedsomkostningerne.

oracle.definition: A data source or feed from a third party used for determining outcomes for smart contracts.

orc-20-tokens.definition: ORC-20-tokens kører på bitcoin-blockchainen og repræsenteres som JSON-filer (JavaScript Object Notation), der er indskrevet på satoshis med et ordinal-serienummer, svarende til BRC-20-tokens.

order-book.definition: En elektronisk liste over udestående købs- og salgsordrer for et specifikt aktiv på en børs eller markedsplads.

ordinals.definition: Ordinaler er NFT-lignende enheder, der kan præges direkte på Bitcoin-blockchainen.

orphan-block.definition: A block whose parent block is unknown, formed in older versions of Bitcoin Core, where ancestry data wasn't required.

pancakeswap.definition: PancakeSwap er en decentraliseret exchange (DEX), der bruger en AMM-model. Det er tilgængeligt i flere blockchain-netværk med forskellige DeFi-produkter og -tjenester.

paper-wallet.definition: A piece of paper on which the public and private keys of a cryptocurrency address are physically printed out.

parallelization.definition: Parallelisering er en tilgang til transaktionsbehandling, der strukturerer netværket til at validere flere transaktioner samtidigt.

passive-management.definition: An investing strategy that doesn’t rely on active market exposure but rather tracks an existing economic index.

peer-to-peer.definition: When two or more computers are connected and share workload or resources without relying on a centralized server.

pegged-currency.definition: En tilknyttet valuta er en type valuta, hvis værdi er tæt knyttet til værdien af en anden valuta, råvare eller kurv af valutaer.

permissionless-blockchain.definition: Permissionless blockchains er åbne netværk, der giver alle mulighed for at deltage i konsensusprocessen uden at skulle indhente godkendelse, tilladelse eller autorisation.

phishing.definition: A malicious attack where a bad actor will attempt to obtain the credentials of a user in order to gain unauthorised access into their account.

plasma.definition: An Ethereum off-chain scaling solution which may allow Etherum to greatly increase the transactions per second capablities.

polkadot-crowdloan.definition: A crowdsourcing system that allows participants to support specific projects by staking DOT.

ponzi-scheme.definition: A scam in which new investors' funds are used to pay returns promised to previous investors. Do not invest in these.

premining.definition: Lær om forudgående mining i blockchain og kryptovalutaer, dens formål, potentielle fordele, ulemper, kritik og indvirkning på markedsresultater.

price-action.definition: The price movements of a financial asset over time. Plotted on a chart, it can be used by traders to identify trade setups.

prisoners-dilemma.definition: An example that shows why two individuals might not cooperate, even if it may appear to be in their best interest.

private-key.definition: In the context of cryptocurrency, a private key is a number that allows users to sign transactions and to generate receiving addresses.

private-sale.definition: An early stage investment round for strategic investors with a considerable amount of investible funds.

progressive-web-application.definition: An application that is created through the use of modern web technologies and follows basic web standards.

proof-of-attendance-protocol-poap.definition: A protocol that creates digital badges or collectibles to celebrate and record the attendance of an event. POAPs are minted as ERC-721 tokens on the Ethereum blockchain.

proof-of-reserves-por.definition: Proof of Reserves (PoR) er en verifikation, der beviser, at en børs har midler til at dække brugernes aktiver.

proof-of-stake.definition: A consensus mechanism that reward block validators according to the amount of coins they have at stake.

proof-of-staked-authority-posa.definition: Proof of Staked Authority fusionerer Proof of Stake med Proof of Authority og forbedrer blockchain-sikkerheden gennem sit system til lige indsatser og balanceret validering

proof-of-work.definition: Proof-of-Work er en kryptokonsensusmekanisme, hvor minere bruger specialudstyr til at løse kryptografiske gåder for at validere transaktioner og skabe nye blokke.

proposer-builder-separation-pbs.definition: Proposer-builder separation (PBS) is an Ethereum concept aiming to improve scalability by dividing the responsibilities of block building into block proposers and block builders.

proto-danksharding.definition: Proto-danksharding fungerer som en midlertidig skalerbarhedsløsning før implementeringen af danksharding, som markerer den sidste fase af Ethereum 2.0 (Serenity).

pseudorandom.definition: The property of a definite function that can produce an outcome that passes statistical tests of randomness.

public-key.definition: En offentlig nøgle er halvdelen af et nøglepar, der bruges til at kryptere meddelelser eller verificere digitale signaturer. I kryptorummet fungerer det i bund og grund som din wallet-adresse.

pump-and-dump.definition: Pump-and-dumps er en vildledende praksis, der anvendes i krypto, hvor prisen på et digitalt aktiv kunstigt pustes op og dumpes, hvilket forårsager et kraftigt fald i tokenværdien.

quantitative-easing-qe.definition: Lær om kvantitativ lempelse (Quantitative Easing, QE), som er et værktøj, som centralbanker bruger til at styrke økonomier. Forstå dens indvirkning på finans- og kryptovalutamarkederne.

quantitative-tightening-qt.definition: Lær om kvantitative stramninger og deres indvirkning på finans- og kryptomarkederne. Forstå, hvordan centralbankernes politikker påvirker aktivpriser og stemning.

quantum-computing.definition: Using particles that can be in superposition. These particles represent qubits and can take the value of 1, 0 or both.

race-attack.definition: When two transactions are created with the same funds at the same time, with the intention of spending those funds twice.

ransomware.definition: A type of malware which takes over your computer and threatens to destroy or reveal files unless a ransom is paid.

real-world-assets-rwas.term: Aktiver i den virkelige verden (Real World Assets, RWA'er)
real-world-assets-rwas.definition: Aktiver i den virkelige verden henviser til håndgribelige, fysiske aktiver med iboende værdi, f.eks. fast ejendom, råvarer eller kunst, der er tokeniseret til brug på blockchainen.

recession.definition: Forstå recessioner, og hvordan de kan påvirke kryptovalutamarkederne: Udforsk kompleksiteten og usikkerheden, når økonomiske nedture møder digitale aktiver.

recursive-inscription.definition: Rekursiv inskription indebærer indlejring af information i sig selv og skaber en referencesløjfe. Få mere at vide om, hvordan det fungerer inden for Bitcoin og kryptovaluta.

rekt.definition: A slang term used to define someone or something that has been destroyed or experienced catastrophic failure and a synonym for liquidated

relative-strength-index.definition: A technical indicator that measures market momentum & used to identify overbought and oversold conditions.

resistance.definition: A term in Technical Analysis (TA). When a price that is increasing finds resistance. Usually compared with previous highs.

return-on-investment.definition: A measure used in order to assess the efficiency of an investment. The ratio between net profit and net cost.

revenge-trading.definition: Udforsk begrebet hævnhandel, hvordan det fungerer, og hvad dets farer er. Lær, hvordan det kan påvirke handlende økonomisk og følelsesmæssigt.

risk-premium.definition: Risikopræmie i finansiering er det afkast, investorer forventer eller kræver for højere risiko, hvilket er afgørende for informerede investeringsbeslutninger. Læs mere på Binance Academy.

roadmap.definition: A business planning technique which lays out the short and long term goals of a company within a flexible estimated timeline.

routing-attack.definition: Attack on the Internet Service Provider level to affect uptime or participation in a web-enabled system, such as a blockchain.

rug-pull.definition: A rug pull in the crypto industry is when a development team suddenly abandons a project and sells or removes all its liquidity.

sahm-rule.definition: Sahm-reglen registrerer recessioner ved at overvåge arbejdsløsheden. Hvis gennemsnittet for 3 måneder stiger med 0,5 % fra det laveste i det forløbne år, er en recession sandsynlig.

sandwich-trading.definition: Sandwichhandel, også kendt som sandwichangreb eller sandwiching, er en handelsstrategi eller manipulationsteknik på markederne for kryptovaluta.

satoshi.definition: The smallest unit of a bitcoin, as defined by the Bitcoin protocol. It equals one-hundred-millionth of a bitcoin or 0.00000001 BTC.

satoshi-nakamoto.definition: Satoshi Nakamoto was the pseudonym of the creator or creators of the bitcoin protocol and whitepaper.

secure-asset-fund-for-users.term: Secure Asset Fund for Users (SAFU) (forsikringsfond for brugere)
secure-asset-fund-for-users.definition: Secure Asset Fund for Users er en nødgarantifond, som blev oprettet af Binance i 2018.

securities-and-exchange-commission.definition: Et uafhængigt statsligt organ med ansvar for regulering af værdipapirmarkederne.

security-audit.definition: A systematic analysis to evaluate how safe a system, smart contract, or blockchain is against attacks or technical failures.

security-token-offering-sto.definition: Forstå Tilbud om Security-tokens (STO), en metode til at rejse kapital ved at udstede security-tokens. Udforsk nogle af de fordele, de tilbyder investorer.

seed-phrase.definition: A seed phrase or menmonic seed is a collection of words that can be used to access your cryptocurrency wallet.

seed-tag.definition: Et tag anvendes til at klassificere kryptovalutaer, der normalt er i deres indledende udviklingsfase, og som muligvis endnu ikke har et fungerende produkt eller en etableret brugerbase.

segregated-witness.definition: Segregeret vidne, ofte forkortet til SegWit, er en opdatering af Bitcoin-protokollen, der er designet til at løse netværkets skalerbarheds- og sikkerhedsproblemer.

selfish-mining.definition: The strategic withholding and releasing of blocks by a miner in order to gain a competitive advantage over the network.

sell-wall.definition: A very large limit sell order or a cumulation of sell orders at the same price level on an order book for an asset.

sentiment.definition: The overall attitude of a community in regards to a cryptocurrency or within investors towards a certain financial market.

sharding.definition: Sharding er en metode til opdeling af blockchains (eller andre typer databaser) i mindre, opdelte blockchains, der administrerer specifikke datasegmenter.

sharpe-ratio.definition: A ratio created in 1966 that investors and economists use to assess the potential return of investment (ROI).

sidechains.definition: Sidekæder er uafhængige blockchains, der er forbundet med en overordnet blockchain, designet til at forbedre skalerbarheden og lette overførsler af digitale aktiver mellem netværk.

simple-moving-average-sma.definition: Udforsk enkle glidende gennemsnit (SMA'er), som er grundlæggende tekniske analyseværktøjer, som handlende bruger til at identificere markedstendenser og potentielle købs- eller salgssignaler.

slashing.definition: Slashing er en mekanisme til at straffe ondsindet eller uagtsom adfærd i blockchains, der er afhængige af staking og bruger Proof of Stake (PoS)-konsensusmekanismen.

slippage.definition: Slippage opstår, når en handel afregnes til en anden pris end oprindeligt anmodet om eller forventet, normalt på markeder med lav likviditet og ved brug af markedsordrer.

smart-contract.definition: Smart contracts er selvudførende kontrakter, der findes på visse blockchain-netværk. Deres betingelser og vilkår er skrevet direkte ind i koden.

smart-contract-wallet.definition: Smart contract-wallets er krypto-wallets, der udnytter programmerbare smart contracts til at introducere avancerede funktioner og forbedrede sikkerhedsfunktioner.

snapshot.definition: The ability to record the state of a blockchain ledger, storage device, or computer system at a specific point in time.

social-recovery-wallet.definition: Wallet til social genopretning er krypto-wallets, der tillader krypto-genopretning. De bruger betroede kontakter, så brugerne kan få adgang igen i tilfælde af mistede nøgler eller glemte adgangskoder.

social-trading.definition: Social handel er en strategi, der gør det muligt for enkeltpersoner at efterligne handelsadfærden hos ekspertinvestorer og professionelle på markedet, ofte i realtid.

socialfi.definition: SocialFi er en forkortelse af Social Finance og repræsenterer en konvergens mellem DeFi-principper (decentralized finance) og dynamikken i sociale medier.

soft-landing.definition: Blød landing refererer til en situation, hvor økonomien bremser gradvist op efter en periode med hurtig vækst, samtidig med at man undgår en recession.

solidity.definition: Solidity er et programmeringssprog skabt i 2014, der blev specielt designet til at skrive og implementere smart contracts på Ethereum-blockchainen.

source-code.definition: Computer code, which is responsible for defining how software will function based on a list of instructions and statements.

spl.definition: SPL står for Solana Program Library (SPL). Det er et sæt af regler og protokoller, der styrer, hvordan tokens opfører sig og interagerer på Solana-netværket.

src-20-tokens.definition: SRC-20 er en tokenstandard, der udvider anvendeligheden af Bitcoin-blockchainen ved at udnytte Bitcoin Stamps til at udstede fungible tokens på Bitcoin-netværket.

stablecoin.definition: En type kryptovaluta, der er designet til at opretholde en stabil værdi i stedet for at opleve betydelige prisændringer.

stagflation.definition: Stagflation er en økonomisk udfordring, der omfatter langsom økonomisk vækst, større mangel på jobtilbud og inflation (stigende priser på varer og tjenesteydelser).

staking-pool.definition: A pool where stakeholders combine their staking power to increase their chance of successfully validating a new block.

state-channel.definition: A two-way communication channel between two users or nodes on a network, or between a user and a service.

steth.definition: Oplev stETH, en tokeniseret repræsentation af Ethereums stakingbelønninger. Få mere at vide om, hvordan det forbedrer tilgængeligheden og likviditeten i investeringer i kryptovaluta.

stock-variable.definition: Udforsk beholdningsvariabler, som er mængder af økonomiske ressourcer målt på et bestemt tidspunkt. Lær nogle eksempler på beholdningsvariabler i krypto.

store-of-value.definition: A commodity, asset or currency that can be saved, retrieved and exchanged at a future date, without suffering depreciation.

supercomputer.definition: A computer or virtual machine that operates at the highest level of currently possible computing power.

supply-chain.definition: A network of people and businesses involved in creating and distributing a particular product or serving a particular customer.

support.definition: A term in Technical Analysis (TA). When a price that is decreasing finds 'support'. Usually compared with lows.

sybil-attack.definition: Få mere at vide om Sybil-angreb, som er en cybertrussel, hvor falske identiteter kan manipulere netværk, hvilket potentielt kan påvirke finans- og kryptovalutamarkederne.

taker.definition: The 'taker' is someone who decides to place an order that is instantly matched with an existing order on the order book.

tank.definition: A term adopted from the traditional financial markets and describes a strong negative financial performance of a particular asset

testnet.definition: Testnet er kopier af hovednettet og tilbyder risikofrie, sikre miljøer til udforskning og test af blockchain-funktioner.

ticker.definition: The trading 'symbol' or shortened name (typically in capital letters) that refer to a coin on a trading platform. For example: BNB

ticker-symbol.definition: Et ticker-symbol er en stenografikode, der repræsenterer en aktie, obligation, kryptovaluta eller andet handlet aktiv. Læs mere på Binance Academy.

token.definition: Tokens (not to be confused with coins) are digital units issued on a blockchain. They can hold value or be redeemed for assets.

token-generation-event-tge.definition: Tokengenereringsbegivenhed (TGE): en crowdfunding-metode til blockchain-projekter. Lær, hvad TGE'er er, deres fordele og ulemper, og hvordan de adskiller sig fra ICO'er.

token-lockup.definition: Token lockup or vesting period refers to the time span in which tokens or coins are not allowed to be transferred or traded.

token-merge.definition: En tokensammenlægning sker, når to eller flere kryptotokens kombineres til et enkelt token. Lær om tokensammenlægning og dens potentielle indvirkning på kryptopriser.

token-sale.definition: The issuance of tokens in exchange for another cryptocurrency. Also referred to as an Initial Coin Offering.

token-standards.definition: Få mere at vide om tokenstandarderne ERC-20, ERC-721, BEP-20 og TRC-20 i blockchain-netværk. Forstå deres rolle i kryptovalutatransaktioner og DApps.

tokenization.definition: Tokenisering henviser til processen med at konvertere aktiver i den virkelige verden, såsom fast ejendom, kunst eller finansielle instrumenter, til digitale tokens på en blockchain.

tokenomics.definition: Ordet "tokenomics" kombinerer to ord, "token" og "economics". Det giver os mulighed for at se, hvordan et token fungerer, samt forskellige faktorer, der kan påvirke dets værdi

total-supply.definition: Refers to the number of coins or tokens that currently exists and are either in circulation or locked somehow.

total-value-locked-tvl.definition: Total Value Locked (TVL) er en udbredt måling i kryptovalutabranchen, der måler den samlede værdi af aktiver, der er låst i en DeFi-protokol (Decentralized Finance).

tradfi.definition: TradFi (traditional finance) is the established financial system most people interact with in their daily lives.

transaction-id.definition: Et transaktions-id (TXID) er en unik streng af tegn, der mærker hver transaktion på blockchainen.

transactions-per-second-tps.definition: The number of transactions that a blockchain network is capable of processing each second.

treasury-bills-t-bills.definition: Skatkammerbeviser er statspapirer med lav risiko, der kan påvirke renten og markedsstemningen. Lær, hvad skatkammerbeviser er, og hvordan de fungerer på Binance Academy.

trueusd-tusd.definition: TrueUSD er en stablecoin, der er knyttet til den amerikanske dollar. Den er integreret med flere blockchain-netværk og er blandt de hurtigst voksende stablecoins.

trustless.definition: No single entity has authority over the system and consensus is achieved between participants who do not have to trust each other.

turing-complete.definition: A machine that, given enough time and memory along with the necessary instructions, can solve any computational problem.

understanding-cz-s-number-4.definition: Tallet 4 repræsenterer ét af CZ's nytårsforsætter om at ignorere FUD, falske nyheder og angreb på Binance.

unit-of-account.definition: One of the primary properties of money. Allowing measurement and comparison of the value of different things.

unspent-transaction-output-utxo.definition: An output created in a transaction, which must be referenced in a future transaction to spend funds.

user-interface.definition: The interface where interactions between humans and machines occur. It establishes how a user can interact with a machine.

utility-token.definition: Et digitalt token udstedt via et blockchain-netværk, ofte via et indledende coin-udbud (ICO), en indledende børsnotering (IEO) eller en tokengenereringsbegivenhed (TGE).

verification-code.definition: Code sent to a second device to ensure the identity of someone logging in to an account. Used for Two-Factor Authentication

virtual-machine.definition: An emulated computer system, or a distributed system that is designed to replicate the features of a computer's architecture.

vladimir-club.definition: A term used to describe someone who has acquired 1% of 1% (0.01%) of the maximum supply of a cryptocurrency.

volatility.definition: How quickly and how much the price of an asset changes. Calculated in terms of standard deviations in the annual return of an asset

volume.definition: A measurement of the number of individual units of an asset that changed hands in a market during a given time.

wagmi.definition: WAGMI er et akronym for "We're All Gonna Make It", der opfordrer til en optimistisk holdning, især inden for kryptofællesskabet.

wallet.definition: Used to send and receive cryptocurrencies. Different types include software wallets, hardware wallets, and paper wallets.

wash-trading.definition: Wash trading er en uetisk og vildledende praksis, der involverer samtidig køb og salg af et bestemt aktiv for at skabe falsk markedsaktivitet.

weak-hands.definition: A term referring to traders or investors who lack the confidence to hold their assets or to follow their trading plans.

weak-subjectivity.definition: Relates to the need for certain nodes to rely on other nodes when determining the current state of a PoS blockchain.

web-1.definition: The initial iteration of the web, when data was primarily read-only pages connected with hyperlinks. Also known as 'read-only' web.

wei.definition: Den mindst mulige værdibetegnelse af ether (ETH), den valuta, der bruges på Ethereum-netværket. Ofte bruges, når der henvises til gaspriser.

weighted-moving-average-wma.definition: Opdag vægtede glidende gennemsnit (WMA'er), som er grundlæggende tekniske analyseværktøjer, der udjævner prisdata med større følsomhed over for de seneste prisændringer.

whale.definition: An individual or organization that holds a large amount of Bitcoins or other cryptocurrency, allowing them to impact the markets.

whiskers.definition: Lines extending from a colored bar in a candlestick chart that indicate the low-high range of a trading pair within a time frame.

whitelist.definition: A list of allowed or trusted individuals, computer programs, or cryptocurrency addresses in relation to a service or event.

wick.definition: Line found on a candlestick chart used to indicate where the price of an asset is fluctuating in regards to its opening and closing price

win-rate.definition: På de finansielle markeder er gevinstrate en måleenhed, der angiver, hvor rentabel en handlende kan være.

wrapped-ether.definition: ERC-20 token representing Ether at a 1:1 ratio. It allows users to trade ETH to ERC-20 tokens on decentralized platforms.

wyckoff.definition: Wyckoff-metoden, der blev skabt af Richard Wyckoff i 1930'erne, er en tilgang til handel og investering, der forårsagede en varig indvirkning på moderne teknisk analyse.

yield-farming.definition: Udbyttefarming er en højrisikopraksis i DeFi, hvor investorer låser aktiver for at give likviditet, udlåne eller stake mod belønninger eller renter.

zero-knowledge-proofs.definition: Verificerer, at transaktioner er gyldige uden at afsløre nogen oplysninger om transaktionerne, hvilket beskytter personlige oplysninger.

zk-rollup.definition: Zk-rollup er en Layer-2-skaleringsløsning, som er designet til at øge dataoverførselshastigheden for transaktioner i blockchain-netværk uden at gå på kompromis med sikkerheden.

zk-snarks.definition: "Zero-Knowledge Succinct Non-Interactive Argument of Knowledge" – en tilgang til zero-knowledge proofs.

zk-starks.definition: zk-STARK gør det muligt for en part (beviseren) at kommunikere validerede data eller udføre beregninger med en tredjepart, uden at dataene eller analysen afsløres over for modparten (verifikatoren).
